text: hi I'm Julia Moscone today we're doing
make a head gravy first heat a saucepan
over medium heat and add butter let it
melt once the butter is melted add the
onion it'll cook down and add sweetness
this is a yellow onion but almost any
type will do continue cooking stirring
often until the onion is soft and
translucent this will take about five
minutes when the onion is ready sprinkle
in the flour stirring constantly some
cooks use cake flour but it's not
necessary all-purpose flour will work
fine cook until the flour is golden to
brown keep an eye on the heat and adjust
it so the mixture doesn't burn once it's
brown you're ready to begin adding the
turkey stock gradually whisk in turkey
stock until you achieve a smooth thick
texture if the mixture feels too thick
add more stock to thin it out save some
stock for later in case you need to thin
it again just before serving when you've
reached the desired consistency take the
pan off the heat and let it cool once it
has cooled pour the mixture into a
container with a lid and refrigerate it
until you're ready to serve for even
better flavor on Thanksgiving you can
scrape the turkey pan drippings into the
gravy as you reheat it before serving
Oh
Oh
